results.name: Column 1 of A237270, also the right border.
comment: First differs from A241559 at a(45).
If n is an odd prime then a(n) = (n + 1)/2 = A241558(n) = A241559(n).
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n = 45 the symmetric representation of sigma(45) = 78 has three parts [23, 32, 23], both the first and the last term are equal to 23, so a(45) = 23.
mathematica: (* computing only the first part of the symmetric representation of sigma(n) *)

a241838[n_] := Module[{r=row[n], widths={}, i=1, w=0, len, legs}, w+=f[n, i]; While[i<=r && w!=0, AppendTo[widths, w]; i++; w+=f[n, i]]; len=Length[widths]; legs=Map[g[n, #]&, Range[len]]; If[len<r, widths.legs, 2*widths.legs-Last[widths]]]
